Description: Blue glazed composition shabti with a lappet-wig, a modelled face and joined hands in relief holding an incised hoe and the string of the seed-basket that hangs over the shoulder; the front of the leg section is inscribed with black painted Hieroglyphs; there is a back-pillar and a plinth beneath the feet.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore (perhaps)
